oai_dc:dc.dc:title: THE NEW INSTALLATION OF THE U-OSCILLATING WATER COLUMN BREAKWATER IN THE PORT OF SALERNO FOR THE WAVE ENERGY EXPLOITATION
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Romolo, Alessandra
Fiamma, Vincenzo
Malara, Giovanni
Laface, Valentina
Spanò, Antonino Simone
Timpano, Bruna
Valentino, Elena
Lalicata, Gianluigi
Caputo, Fausto
Arena, Felice
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: This article describes the characteristics of a U- Oscillating Water Column plant, named also REWEC3 (REsonant Wave Energy Converter), that has been realized in the Port of Salerno (Italy). The objective of the infrastructure is to enlarge the port basin area by taking advantage of the most recent developments in the field of caisson breakwaters. The building of the caissons was completed in 2022, when a monitoring activity started of three active chambers. In the paper, a general overview of the U-OWC device and of monitoring activity of active cells is given in conjunction with an initial expected U- OWC plant performance.
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: Coastal Engineering Proceedings; No. 38 (2024): Proceedings of 38th Conference on Coastal Engineering, Rome, Italy, 2024; structures.94
